Hi, my name is Clarke Rodgers,
and I am an Enterprise
Strategist at AWS.

I am part of a team of former
customer C-suite executives

who led large-scale transformations
at their prior employers

and now inspire and support
AWS customers in their transformations.

Before joining AWS, I was a chief
information security officer

(CISO) in the insurance
and financial services industry.

I now engage with customer
executives and boards across

the globe, guiding them on best
practices and lessons learned

to accelerate their own digital
transformation journey.

I help them view security
not only as a necessary

core capability but as a strategic
business driver.

So, as a CISO, why should I care
about the cloud?

This was a common question
in the early days of the cloud,

and still comes up with some
frequency.

I address it by covering
the following three points.

First, security is there to help
the organization mitigate
risk.

The business you support
is either already using the cloud,

planning a migration to get there,
or somewhere in between.

Businesses are embracing
the capabilities of the cloud

to deliver services or products
for their customers.

In this paradigm shift, security
teams have the opportunity

to embrace cloud adoption
and actually lead their businesses
through it.

Second, cloud scale helps security
teams do more with less.

Regardless of industry,
security teams typically

donâ€™t have enough people to do
all the things needed to protect

their organizations
and stay ahead of adversaries.

The cloud is a security
game changer.

The scale, the myriad managed
security services, visibility,

and automation capabilities
are a force multiplier
for security teams.

Why spend time, money, and resources
on building and maintaining

security capabilities
when you can build your security

program on top of highly available
security services provided
by Amazon Web Services (AWS)?

Use the cloud infrastructure
to protect your infrastructure

through automation, and use your
valuable human resources

to focus on the differentiated
value they bring by mitigating
risk for your business.

Finally, use inherent security
compliance controls that are
already there.

AWS is architected to be the
most flexible and secure cloud

computing environment
available today.

Our core infrastructure
is built to satisfy the security

requirements of the military,
global banks, and other highly
sensitive organizations.

This is backed by a deep set
of cloud security tools with

over 300 security, compliance,
and governance services
and features.

In addition, AWS supports
98 security standards and compliance

certifications, including
PCI DSS, HIPAA, HITECH,
FedRAMP, and many others.
